product_title: Dr.Althea 345 Relief Cream | Daily Face Moisturizer for Soothing Recovery and Blemish Care with PDRN & Niacinamide

overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Relief Architect
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr.Althea strips away the fluff to present skincare as a structural equation (3+4+5). It feels like a prescription from a modern, transparent apothecary—prioritizing barrier relief and blemish recovery over sensory indulgence. It acts as a rational guardian for sensitive, acne-prone skin, using rigorous data ('177% boost') to validate its efficacy.

foundation.title: The Safe Restoration
foundation.description: The brand acts as The Healer, treating skin sensitivity as a condition to be fixed rather than a baseline to be pampered. Anchored in Safety First values, it prioritizes 'relief' and 'hypoallergenic' tolerance over aggressive potency. It occupies The Medical Authority slot, using stark clinical codes to frame a daily moisturizer as a recovery tool.

identity.title: The Precise Professional
identity.description: There is zero ambiguity here; the personality is The Reliable Expert—distant, competent, and highly structured. Dominated by The Sage archetype (60%), it uses truth and transparency (the '345' ingredient count) as its primary currency. The visual code is Pharma-Code: stark black-on-white typography that signals 'Pro Lab' sterility.

communication.title: The Rational Chemist
communication.description: Messaging uses The Chemist territory, hooking users with specific ingredients (PDRN, Niacinamide) and validating with 'Korea Institute' data. The Narrative is a Lab Breakthrough, citing clinical tests and 'Pro Lab' origins. It focuses purely on Science Education, using infographics and ingredient breakdowns to prove efficacy.

benefits.title: Calm Recovery
benefits.description: Functionally, it offers Restoration for compromised barriers, soothing redness and repairing blemishes. This delivers Emotional Relief, removing the anxiety of reactions for sensitive skin users. Socially, it functions as The Safe Choice—a rational, highly-rated purchase that signals prudence over status.

marker_1.reasoning: The product is explicitly named 'Relief Cream' and targets 'Blemish Care' and 'Soothing Recovery.' The origin of authority is 'Pro Lab' and 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' (Slider A: 2/5 Derm-Validated). The mission is to remove a negative—redness, blemishes, sensitivity (Slider B: 1/5 Pathology Cure). It treats the skin condition, not just the aesthetic.
marker_1.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Soothing Recovery... Blemish Care... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... red blemishes

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Sliders (Clinical + Fixing) map directly to Territory 1. The full PDP content is laser-focused on 'relief' and 'recovery'.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)

marker_2.reasoning: The brand brings 'Pro Lab' science to a mass audience (Rank #7 in Face Moisturizers). The scope is specific individual skin health ('reduce dark spots', 'restore dull skin') rather than a global crusade (Slider A: 1/5 Micro-Correction). The access is democratic ($22.95, widely available, 'Daily Face Moisturizer'), making clinical care approachable (Slider B: 5/5 Democratic).
marker_2.evidence: Daily Face Moisturizer... Best Sellers Rank: #7... 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients... 345 Relief Cream

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Micro-correction scope combined with high accessibility fits The Democratizers perfectly. It brings clinical specificity to the mass market.

marker_3.reasoning: While transparency is high (listing ingredient counts), the primary trade-off prioritizes safety and soothing for compromised skin. Claims like 'Hypoallergenic,' 'Skin Irritation Tested,' and 'free from artificial coloring' dominate (Slider A: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is present via the '345' concept, but it serves to prove the safety/gentleness (Slider B: 2/5 Evidence-First).
marker_3.evidence: Care for sensitive skin... Skin Irritation Tested... free from artificial coloring, fragrance, and parabens... safe and gentle for acne-prone skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: High focus on 'safe,' 'gentle,' and 'free-from' places this in Safety First, even with the high data density.

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is stark, clinical, and sterile—black text on white tubes, 'Pro Lab' branding, and grid layouts (Slider A: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The positioning is utilitarian and essential ('Daily Face Moisturizer', 'Travel Size') rather than prestigious or luxury (Slider B: 2/5 Daily Essential). It looks and behaves like a pharmacy prescription.
marker_4.evidence: Pro Lab... Stark black-on-white typography... Daily Face Moisturizer... 345 Relief Cream... Clinical Trial Completed

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Sterile visuals + essential utility positioning solidly map to Territory 1. The 'Pro Lab' branding is the clincher.

marker_5.reasoning: The brand voice is distant and professional. There are no jokes, no slang, and no emotive warmth. It speaks in facts: 'This cream contains...', 'Clinically tested...' (Slider A: 2/5 Distant). It positions itself as an unquestionable authority via 'Pro Lab' and 'Korea Institute' citations (Slider B: 4/5 The Specialist).
marker_5.evidence: Why Choose Dr.Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Clinically tested... 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Low warmth + high authority leads directly to The Reliable Expert. The tone is purely informational and credentialed.

marker_6.reasoning: The primary archetype is The Sage (60%) because the entire brand concept ('345') is based on categorization, explanation, and logic. It seeks to reveal the truth of the formula. The Caregiver (30%) is the secondary driver, providing the 'Relief' and 'Soothing' promise. A dash of The Creator (10%) appears in the structured, 'Pro Lab' system design. The mix lands in The Philosopher territory—driven by clarity and principles.
marker_6.evidence: 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients... 4 Nourishing Ingredients... 5 Soothing Ingredients... Pro Lab... Why Choose Dr.Althea

marker_7.reasoning: The voice is grave and serious (Humor 1/5), highly professional (Formality 3/5), and matter-of-fact (Enthusiasm 2/5). It relies on structure and data points rather than emotion to persuade. It sounds like a lab report or a prescription label.
marker_7.evidence: 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients... 4 Nourishing Ingredients... Clinically tested as non-comedogenic... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Matches hard rule for Clinical Authority: Humor <= 2, Enthusiasm <= 2, Formality >= 2.

marker_8.reasoning: The visual world is defined by 'Stark black-on-white typography' and 'Pro Lab' aesthetics. The temperature is cool and sterile (Slider A: 1/5). The layout is rigid, utilizing grids and stacked information to convey control and precision (Slider B: 2/5 Structured). This is the look of the laboratory.
marker_8.evidence: Stark black-on-white typography... Pro Lab... minimalist white squeeze tube... scientific glassware imagery

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Sterile temperature + Structured layout maps perfectly to Pharma-Code.

marker_8.look_and_feel: A stark, minimalist clinical aesthetic that uses grid layouts and dense typography to mimic a medical dossier.
marker_8.primary_palette: High-contrast clinical white and black with accents of medical green and pale yellow.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook targets the components: '3 Blemish Relief Ingredients', 'PDRN', 'Niacinamide'. It sells the molecule (Slider A: 2/5 Component). The persuasion is rooted in raw data and testing: 'Clinically tested', '177% immediate boost' (Slider B: 1/5 Raw Data). It assumes the user wants to know the mechanics.
marker_9.evidence: PDRN & Niacinamide... 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients... 177% immediate boost... Clinically tested

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Component hook + Raw Data persuasion aligns with The Chemist territory.

marker_10.reasoning: There is no founder story visible. The protagonist is the institution: 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' and the 'Pro Lab' (Slider A: 1/5 Nobel). The setting is explicitly the lab, referenced by 'Pro Lab' branding and 'Clinical Trial Completed' seals (Slider B: 1/5 Sterile). It creates trust through institutional rigor.
marker_10.evidence: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Pro Lab... Clinical Trial Completed... Clinically tested

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Institutional protagonist + Lab setting maps to The Lab Breakthrough.

marker_11.reasoning: The primary validator is the 'Korea Institute' and the claim 'Dermatologist tested' (Slider A: 1/5 The Board). The proof is presented as data points ('177% boost') and clinical seals (Slider B: 2/5 The Stat). Even though reviews are high, the PDP prioritizes institutional certification as the primary truth.
marker_11.evidence: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... 177% immediate boost

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Expert validation + Statistical proof maps to Derm-Validation.

marker_11.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Stat ('95% saw reduction in acne')

marker_12.reasoning: The '345' framework is a proprietary system/complex (Slider A: 3/5 Signature Complex). The scope is highly targeted: it is specifically for 'Acne-prone skin,' 'Red blemishes,' and 'Soothing Recovery' (Slider B: 4/5 Problem Solver). It distinguishes itself by being the specialist for compromised skin barriers.
marker_12.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Blemish Care... Red blemishes

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Signature Complex ownership (345 system) + Specialist scope (acne/blemish) maps to Territory 4 - The Specialist.

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)

marker_13.reasoning: The PDP allocates significant space to 'Ingredient Focus' graphics, clinical seals, and numbered lists explaining the formula (Slider A: 2/5 The Explainer). The intent is to prove the product's safety and efficacy through 'Clinical Trial Completed' evidence rather than lifestyle vibes (Slider B: 1/5 The Thesis).
marker_13.evidence: Ingredient Focus... Clinical Trial Completed... 3 Blemish Relief Ingredients... Pro Lab

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Education depth + Trust intent maps to Science Education.

marker_14.reasoning: The functional goal is to 'Soothe,' 'Restore,' and provide 'Relief' to compromised skin (Slider A: 4/5 The Healer). The outcome is Biological Health—treating 'red blemishes' and 'sensitive skin' rather than cosmetic perfection (Slider B: 2/5 Sensory/Health). It is about returning the skin to a healthy baseline.
marker_14.evidence: Soothing Recovery... Restore dull skin... Red blemishes... Care for sensitive skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Healer action + Health/Sensory outcome maps to Restoration.

marker_15.reasoning: The emotional promise is the removal of pain and worry. Terms like 'Relief,' 'Soothing,' 'Calming,' and 'Safe' target a user in a state of anxiety about their skin condition (Slider A: 1/5 Panic/Relief). The perception is internal—feeling 'comfortable' and 'safe' in one's skin, not showing off (Slider B: 1/5 Sanctuary).
marker_15.evidence: Relief Cream... Calming ingredients... Safe and gentle... Soothe your skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Relief anxiety + Internal perception maps to Relief / Safety.

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)

marker_16.reasoning: Buying this is a vote for logic. The user chooses it because it is 'Clinically tested,' 'Vegan,' and 'Free from' harmful ingredients (Slider A: 2/5 Smart Choice). It is a high-ranking, widely adopted product (#7 Face Moisturizer), signaling a Mass/Standard orientation rather than a niche flex (Slider B: 2/5 The Trending). It's the sensible, verified choice.
marker_16.evidence: Clinically tested... Vegan-certified... 11,804 global ratings... Best Sellers Rank: #7

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Rational choice + Mass/Trending orientation maps to The Pragmatist.

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Smart Choice (because it makes sense)

marker_17.reasoning: With 11,000+ reviews and a top 10 ranking, this product offers the safety of the herd. The user wants to assimilate with the Majority who have found 'relief' (Slider A: 1/5 Normalization). It is not about standing out; it's about finding a reliable solution that 'everyone' trusts (Slider B: 1/5 The Majority).
marker_17.evidence: 11,804 global ratings... #7 in Face Moisturizers... 4.6 out of 5 stars

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Normalization + Majority dynamic maps to The Safe Choice.

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization ('I want to look like everyone else')
